what-it-does: Checks for unnecessary parentheses on functools.lru_cache decorators.
why-is-this-bad:
Since Python 3.8, functools.lru_cache can be used as a decorator without
trailing parentheses, as long as no arguments are passed to it.
example:
import functools


@functools.lru_cache()
def foo(): ...



Use instead:


import functools


@functools.lru_cache
def foo(): ...
